author: Missy06
title: My disabled daughter's respite
body:
I have an adult daughter who has down's syndrome and rheumatoid arthritis in her knees and hips, she also has gallstones and hearing difficulties, ADHD and anxiety issues.  
My daughter is always with me at home and mainly spends her time in her room, she is very attached to me and doesn't want me to go out for shopping without her but she just wants me to stay at home.  
She started going to Thornton Gardens last year before it became a care home for adults with disabilities. She liked it but wasn't sure, then recently it's became an adults with disabilities care home and she goes for respite. She's actually going and sitting in the dining room with everyone instead of having dinner in her room, as she does this at home, and she went to the lounge and went and joined in doing art in the art activity room.  
The staff are great with my daughter, she gets lots of hugs and she's happy to tell me who they are. I've never seen her come out of her shell so much and they take her to activities - ie cinema, out for walk, bowling etc.  
I can go away for my wee break knowing she's getting well looked after and also the fact she's happy for me to leave her for once, the staff love her and have lots of patience with her and she's even got a soft spot for the cook.  
I'm so glad I got my daughter in to this respite, it gives me a break from my her, which I need at times, and also gives her a wee break without me. I'm much happier now and the fact my daughter's happy to go to respite is a bonus and the staff are so friendly and helpful to the parents.

readBy.name: Office of Michelle Thomson, MSP for Falkirk East

title: The Reception Area
body: The reception area is your first impression of the surgery and it's extremely poor! A condemned settee and a few plastic chairs dotted about a rather large area. There are no high chairs with arms for people with mobility issues especially when your appointment with the nurse is 30mins late and you are so uncomfortable on the chairs provided

title: Unacceptable
body:
Really shocking that a GP surgery will leave the phone ringing for over 35 minutes - at which point I gave up. 
Especially frustrating as for 25 of those minutes, it was telling me that I was first in the queue…

title: Good Practice
body: I felt the need to give a good review about this surgery. On the last three occasions I have needed this service within the last year, I have always been able to speak to the receptionist without waiting too long in a queue and they are always polite and efficient. A follow up triage phone call has usually been no more than one hour later and if required have been given an appointment that same day. I have found the doctors very thorough and didn’t feel rushed given a plan of action that will help my health issues. Even better now that I can receive a text message regarding test results and any further action. In the last 2 years the surgery seems to have improved in all areas. I think the staff deserve some recognition for all their hard work.

author: hawkzt49
title: Stressful experience in the Assessment Unit
body:
Pregnant 38 weeks!  
Headache, vision issues and more symptoms. We are now nearly a week on. After trying to cope with paracetamol at home called FMAU. Due to symptoms including chest pain (MSK now confirmed) I was sent to A&E for investigation then sent up to FMAU - I was in from 11:00 am to 7:00pm between the two departments.  
Returned the next day for more blood results. Was told at 2:45pm I was being admitted and the plan was pain relief and more tests. Couldn't fault how they were really trying to get to the bottom of the whole thing. I was became more and more distressed due to noise and light sensitivity even after the paracetamol IV.  
FMAU was becoming very overwhelmed at this stage it was after 7:00 pm & I was still sitting in FMAU. At this point I had told my story to two different doctors. Feeling like I was back at square one I hadn't a clue what was going on. I hadn't been offered even a glass of water and I sent my next of kin home.  
One lady was on a trolley in labour waiting to be taken round to the labour ward. Another lady in labour getting gas and air sounding very distressed due to her pains - this is simply not good enough. They deserved privacy not sitting in a ward full of other people in discomfort. The buzzer for the door constantly going and staff chasing their tails unable to cope due to trying to find beds. Relaying on students to try and fill the gap of an already stretched service.  
So after 8 hours I was finally given a bed to "Rest" in a bay with mums & babies. Being told my CT scan will be at 4:00 am. Well I think I would sleep better in a children's soft play area. Everyone is being thrown in wherever they can go.  
Not enough staff, not enough beds, not enough space  
I am glad this will be my last child as I wouldn't want to go through all this again. As I fear this will only get more severe and with there only being one place to give birth in this trust now. You might get better facilities in a vets.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: cratersh47
title: Lack of care
body:
My father arrived at A&E at Lewisham Hospital at 8:00pm last week. He had a stroke two months ago and is paralysed and needs a lot of care.  
He was moved to first Aspen ward at 7:00 am in the morning where my mother stayed on to explain to the nurses his needs. A special diet, mainly liquidised food, a special cup to enable him to drink none of which he could do without assistance. My mother left at 7:30am and returned that day at lunchtime. At 5:00pm that afternoon he was still in the same soiled pad he had arrived in and no one was available to reposition him in order to avoid aggravating his bed sores.  
After speaking to several other wives of patients on the ward it became apparent there was no care at all. Things went from bad to worse. He has been in several hospitals and no where has he been treated in such an inhumane way. What is going on?  
My mother’s sister has had two stays in the same ward in the last two weeks for a blood clot and unfortunately reports that the care is lacking but fortunately she was able to fend for herself.

title: Good service
body: I completed an e-consult and within 2 weeks I have had an X-ray, a f2f appointment a referral to orthopaedics, drop in a poo sample and have a blood test booked all within 2 weeks.

author: Carm2023
title: A brilliant experience of care
body:
My labour experience was a bit overwhelming and resulted in an emergency c section which I found personally challenging.  
However, I wish to thank the entire team of professionals at the PRM who provided exceptional care and support, assisting me throughout when I had heightened distress and anxiety. They went above and beyond. Special thanks to Debi my midwife throughout the night, and the anesthetist team Emily, Scott and others. Even when hurdles came, you all gave your absolute best efforts to support me and my partner to bring my beautiful daughter into the world.  
I'd also like to thank the staff on the postnatal ward who were so kind and supportive when my emotions were high and I needed some kind words.  
Overall, brilliant experience of care. Truly remarkable and I would recommend anyone have their baby at this hospital.

author: Austen fan
title: They make this journey so much easier to face
body:
At the start of August I had my second cycle of carbo/plat and just 5 minutes before the end there was a bit of drama. The tube of the drip caught, the needle slipped, it hurt and my hand swelled.  
The reaction by the nurses was fantastic and a big shout out to them. They were professional, confident and reassuring, which meant I did not worry, after all its poison going in to your body.  
The doctor was called and he was excellent. I saw him again the next day and the protocol was followed to the letter and I cannot speak highly enough of him. He explained everything and was professional caring and kind.  
I would like to thank all the nurses on duty that day and those on duty at the Bostonian. They are all stars and it makes this journey so much easier to face when people are so kind.

author: Austen fan
title: A brilliant response for a patient on a challenging journey
body:
I needed to call the assessment centre at Lincoln as I was feeling wobbly following chemotherapy. Despite it being over the phone, the nurse I spoke with was extremely kind and caring and highly professional. She went through everything and reassured me.  
Lincolnshire is a huge county and being able to speak to someone who responds in such a way is brilliant for a patient on a challenging journey. I am extremely grateful.  
My call was a week after my chemo, because I felt wobbly. Huge thanks to the Staff Nurse that answered.

author: indiady63
title: Professional and caring OT support
body:
Just over a year ago I was admitted to the Ulster with a spinal abscess which led to my losing the use of my legs. I spent a total of eight months there, of which the first two were spent fighting the original infection, complicated by an abdominal problem which manifested at the same time.  
I was then informed that I would be transferred to the specialist Spinal Cord Injury Unit at Musgrave Park for rehab. I hope I'm not misrepresenting the approach taken at the Ulster when I say that Physio and OT were made aware of my presence and that I might benefit from their attentions, but that as I was scheduled for rehab elsewhere it was not a priority. I should stress that I make no criticism of that policy, it makes sense in the context. Nor would I be critical that I had no regular contact with Physio during this time.  
Musgrave's SCIU is the only such unit in the province, so I ended up waiting 6 months to be transferred, time which might have been wasted, indeed during which my condition may well have regressed, were it not for the intervention of one of the OTs. Jessica took it on herself to ensure I had some opportunity to start regaining strength and balance.  
On my first time out of bed in two months I was a giant rag doll, unable to sit upright for more than a few seconds. Jessica and her colleagues provided an armchair so that I could work up the number of hours I could manage upright; they had me practice basic motor skills and daily tasks like teeth cleaning and started my working towards using a board to do transitions. They were constantly professional, respectful, caring, encouraging and fun. They secured a wheelchair for me which meant I could get off the ward and get outside for the first time in months. Sometimes, if unable to come herself, Jessica had a student work on relaxation techniques.  
The upshot of this is that I arrived at Musgrave in much better shape physically and emotionally than would otherwise have been the case. There is no absolute rule, but generally 3 months is the allotted span for rehab there. Had I not benefitted from the help of my friends in OT I would estimate it would have taken me my first five or six weeks to get to the same level This in turn had a knock-on effect on what I've been able to achieve and the level of independence I can aspire to in future.  
I am enormously indebted to Jessica and her colleagues.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: No communication
body:
A relative went in for an emergency transplant,although they appeared to take care of him whilst in there,realistically the care was very poor.
Absolutely zero contact with the family to either let them know they had gone down for the operation or when they came back,if it was successful or how the patient was managing.
Many many phones calls to the ward to try and find out, were either unanswered or when answered you we're treated abruptly and made to feel like a nuisance.
There was no communication whatsoever between the staff and immediate next of kin.
During such a difficult and nervous time the experience was made worse by not knowing what was happening and the staff treating such an important operation as if it was just like going to the dentist. 
Staff should keep the next of kin fully informed at every stage and not just ring up after 5 day's and expect someone to come and then take the patient home.with no advice on aftercare or what to do if the body rejects the organ!.
Very very poor

author: Cinders23
title: My experience when my mum fell
body:
After my elderly mum had a fall in her garden an ambulance was called. This arrived promptly and the crew were brilliant in the way they dealt with the situation. When I arrived they were ready to take her to our local A+E department at Dr Grays hospital in Elgin. Unfortunately we had to wait outside in the ambulance until there was a space for us to go in. During that time the team kept my mum comfortable and looked after her needs until she was taken in.  
Once we were taken in everything happened very quickly. The staff nurse and doctor were very attentive. Details and bloods taken, pain relief given. X-rays taken and dressings applied to nasty cuts on leg. Hip not broken. Both myself and mum were given tea and biscuits. All the members of the emergency staff from pick up to departure were very kind, professional and so friendly. I myself work in the NHS but have never been on the other side. All of the staff that had anything to do with my mum's treatment were second to none!  
I am proud to say well done NHS you are fab

author: Emeraldjules
title: It was lovely to feel so supported
body:
Morven, the optometrist, went above and beyond to help my young daughter feel at ease.  
We are trying to get my daughter diagnosed as autistic. She wouldn't get out of the car to go into the hospital and was covering her face with her hands and curling up in a ball. I knew if I pressured her that she would go into a meltdown and we'd be even less likely to get her in.  
I rang the outpatient reception at Yeovil District Hospital and spoke to Angela. She rang me back a couple of minutes later to say that Morven would come out to the car. She was brilliant at chatting to my daughter, not putting any pressure on her, just showing interest in her rainbow dress and her doll. After a few minutes my daughter uncovered her face and uncurled and was soon chatting away with Morven.  
Morven said my daughter could just come and choose a sticker. She happily walked into the hospital and into the consulting room. By this point, my daughter was feeling comfortable with Morven, so when Morven asked if she'd like to sit in the chair, she did and Morven carried out all the tests quickly and cheerily and my daughter was happy to get to choose several stickers! She then had fun in the little play area, so hopefully she will feel happy should've need to come back again.  
A huge thank you to Morven for being so understanding and patient and taking the time to help my daughter, especially when I know you are all under so much pressure and trying not to run late for other patients. I had been so worried about getting my daughter in, I knew it would probably be difficult.  
It was lovely to feel so supported, thank you!

title: Fantastic GP surgery
body: I've been with this GP practice for 10 years and have had really good service. The GP I've seen the most is really good and nothing is too much trouble. All the systems seem efficient to me - for example it's very easy to book appointments online. The reception team have always answered any questions I have. I always feel like the staff really do care about me as a person and don't treat me like a set of symptoms. Cannot recommend this surgery highly enough.

title: Delighted with the care
body: Although standard appointments can be protracted, more urgent ones are arranged quickly. Care is empathetic and the doctors are approachable.

title: Great service if you can get in
body:
Saw a dr yesterday who said to monitor the situation it got worse but when I got through today all I got was a message saying there were no callbacks. I couldn’t speak to anyone to explain the dr had told me to go back
I got an emergency appointment through 111 and the dr called back very quickly. They were really good and helpful but such a shame it’s so difficult to actually get the appointment

author: stardust0808
title: We found the experience transformative and validating
body:
I have thought quite hard about whether to write this or not due to the personal nature of the service but I wanted to make more people aware of this service and not be worried about accessing it.  
I was referred to the relationship and sexual health service by my GP over a year ago after multiple gynae surgeries and a diagnosis of a long term condition that was affecting me physically and mentally. At my first appointment I met Alice and we talked about why I had been referred and what I would like to achieve. Alice warned me it would be work and to think about if this is something I wanted to tackle, and also asked if my partner would come along to the sessions with me.  
My partner then attended all the subsequent sessions. There was plenty of tears, some laughter and a lot of hard work. We had homework from every session!  
What we thought were our initial goals shifted over the 12 sessions, and it was exactly what we didn’t know we needed. We both felt so comfortable with Alice and were never made to feel silly or ashamed. In fact is was quite the opposite. It felt like Alice really saw us both and we found the experience transformative, validating, and it has allowed us to off cast of some heavy weights we didn’t know we were carrying. We attribute this to Alice’s skill -they were warm, friendly and extremely professional.  
I thought 12 sessions, one every two weeks gave us enough time to digest each session before the next one. It was a good length of time over all as it ends up being several months’ worth of therapy. I feel like I would have liked more sessions but really I know we didn’t need them. Alice had prepared us to move on.  
At the final session we were given yet more homework, and Alice helped us figure out how to continue the work we had been doing. We went on holiday not long after our sessions finished and used the time to read the books Alice recommended. It gave us the time and the space to discuss them outside of our usual routine, and have conversations in a way we would never have been able to before this journey. I am very grateful for all the support we received from Alice and this very special service.

author: authenticsf94
title: Still waiting for MRI results after 10 weeks
body:
I was diagnosed with bowel cancer in May and sent for an MRI at the start of June. I was told I should hear back about the results in a week or two.  
Ten weeks later I'm now about to start my fourth round of chemo and I have still not heard anything about my MRI. I think it's awful that I've been made to wait this long with no idea how bad my cancer is.

title: Unorganised Choas
body: I requested a referral letter from my main GP (whoever that is) and asked for a letter to allow for private treatment for vein surgery.  What so got was a Nurse and not a GP, who decided to send me my whole life history from a medical point of view - why!  All I needed was a confirmation that I had not been treated for a condition.  Instead Ingot nothing.  If you speak to reception, it’s like trying to speak to a Bank today - forget it.  All you get is excuses and nonsense.  You never get to resolve things easily.

title: Nurse Weeda
body:
It was quick and nearly painless for my blood test. Knowing I was scared of needles, she told me she's using a small thin one!
Thank you!

author: Disgusted2023
title: Poor service
body:
I am absolutely disgusted with the charade you call the A+E department. Under staffed, no doctors and 7 hrs wait for just blood results.  
In my view your department is pathetic and a joke

readBy.name: Chesterfield Royal Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: golfpp64
title: Communication really needs to be addressed.
body:
Patient in ward 21, most staff friendly, ward exceptionally busy. Improvement can be made in:  
- Communication- staff didn't know I had already been at theatre and didn't know if I had blood thinners.  
-asked for review of analgesia sent home with same no discussion.  
-no pillow slips, 3 hours later still no pillow slips, can't get any pillows to get more comfy.  
-sent home with very short notice with no stair practice. 20 stairs from front of house to bed. Physio coming back next day as I have to be mobile BUT non weight bearing but discharged at 5:00pm that night. Ended up stuck upstairs in my home unable to get to the toilet. I did not realise how difficult stairs would be.  
Communication really needs to be addressed.

title: Great service and communication
body:
I recently registered at the Practice and had great support from the reception staff in doing so. They were friendly, patient and very thorough - making sure I got booked in for a health MOT. I thought this was a great service given the NHS resources are stretched and I am genuinely fit and well. It gave me confidence in the professionalism and culture in the Practice. 
In addition, I required travel vaccines, so booked in with the nurse promptly. The nurse was fantastic! She made a lot of time to talk me through the risks with where I was travelling to, what vaccines and medicines she recommended and also what medicines would not be necessary. She was attentive, personable and left me feeling confident in my experience. I wish I could name her here so she could get the praise - so I will write to the surgery to let them know too! I'm grateful and relieved to have such a wonderful surgery in my neighbourhood. Thank you to the whole team at 306.

author: ADEMed
title: Listening and appreciating my disabilities
body:
Everyone listened to me and have offered lots of support with my disabilities. It’s much appreciated. Everyone was amazing and I thank them all very sincerely.  
It is not the most pleasant procedure but made much easier by the people I met there.

author: nuthatchhj64
title: A very friendly and clean hospital
body:
It was my first time at Stracathro I was in surgical for knee hole surgery. It wasn’t a good time for me to be having the surgery as my husband was in Ninewells with a bad infection from an op the week before at PRI. But I shouldn’t have been concerned the care was second to none and I have nothing but total admiration for each and everyone of the nurses and doctors on duty that day.  
A very friendly and clean hospital with a very relaxed atmosphere despite being very busy. Thank you one and all

author: carinaxy58
title: Starting my road to recovery now!
body:
Last week I went to Stracathro hospital for elective knee surgery. My whole experience at the surgical unit was excellent and every member of staff was friendly and always made me feel welcome to ask things.  
I was very nervous before my operation but the staff helped calm me down and explain the process to make it feel much less daunting. The care I received from each profession was fantastic and I felt very well supported before, during and after my surgery. Hopefully starting my road to recovery now!

author: Greentree
title: I felt I was not important as a service user
body:
I felt the nurse was unprepared. They got labels wrong on bottles, took off plastic gloves to reattach and change labels, risking contaminating samples.  
They took my weight but when I asked if it was in the normal range, they did not tell me, as they said they did not have their glasses on. Their glasses were in a case beside them. I was shocked and bemused by the nurse's attitude.  
At reception I was left standing with my stool test whilst in the back section people checked their mobile phones and chatted. No-one came for five mins. I felt I was not important as a service user. That staff seemed to be busy with their own private preoccupations.

author: Raefae
title: We couldn’t have had a better experience
body:
Our son was born in early August early and the midwives were absolutely amazing.  
My wife got the best care we could have asked for, we felt very lucky.  
Being a same sex couple we never once felt treated any differently from others.  
Having different midwives over the 5 days while we were in, it was nice to get to know them and they get to know us. It’s always nice to share our fertility story when people ask.  
We couldn’t have had a better experience than we did, it was very safe and comfortable.

title: Simply the best
body: The nurse; although running extremely late for my appointment was most apologetic. I felt that the nurse knew her subject, actively listened to me, gave me options and a timeframe to work with the given information. I appreciate medics who are analytical and not too quick to offer a pill.

author: nuthatchqe44
title: The care and professionalism has been outstanding
body:
I had undergone complex surgery (12 hours) at the Glasgow Royal Infirmary to remove a Sarcoma in my gluteus muscle.  
Due to the amazing team at the Glasgow Royal Infirmary headed up by Mr Gupta and Mr Fairbairn the operation was a success. Also Dr Vohra’s team at the Beatson provided amazing support throughout.  
Post op, I required a high level of community care. The district nurses have been looking after my well-being and wound since my operation . They have been exceptional. I would give all their names a mention but would be afraid I left anyone out. This is still ongoing and is overseen by Una, who, with her team, have provided me with post operative care that is second to none and supported me through a very difficult journey.  
I just can’t praise them enough for being there when I most needed them, including out of hours.  
Overall the care and professionalism has been outstanding. I am so grateful to all of the NHS team from nurses to consultants who have saved my life and supported me through a very difficult journey.

readBy.name: East Renfrewshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Stanza
title: The nursing care was outstanding
body:
Day Surgery: Prostate Operation.  
The admission process was very smooth and everything went according to plan. The Green Light Laser operation took place more or less at the promised time and seems to have gone well (only 4 days ago, but so far so good!).  
Due to personal circumstances I was allowed to stay overnight, and was given a single room, which was excellent.  
The nursing care was outstanding - everyone was very, very kind and couldn't do enough for me. I'll mention Dawn, Rachel, Karen and Corinne only because I remember their names, but others were first class too.  
My only reservation is that I did not see the consultantat any time before or after the operation. Pre-op I had some time with a staff member (not in scrubs and not identified in any specific role) who did a good job of explaining the operation and associated risks. However, post-op I saw nobody other than the nurses.  
Perhaps it is such a straightforward operation that the consultant's time can be spent more profitably elsewhere, but as a patient I would have found it reassuring to have been told how the operation had gone by the person who had done it.

author: cetusmc57
title: Efficient and friendly treatment
body: I attended for oral surgery at Treliske. My treatment at the department was very efficient and friendly especially from the dental nurse.

author: Rjincewind
title: A great experience
body:
We were referred to Isobel the MSK specialist physiotherapist for a problem we were told in the past was a sacroilliac joint moving too much . This was a diagnosis that was given before we came to live here. We were advised that physiotherapy may help and were sceptical that the physio may move it too much.  
Only when I saw Isobel did she tell me that in fact the reason for the pain was probably due to the sacroilliac joint on the left hand side not moving enough and being stuck . After taking painkillers of different types for at least 10 yrs and wearing a support sacroilliac belt 24/7 using tens machine and Ibroprofen gel and buying a mobility scooter; it was a great result only after three visits and doing the exercises at home regularly that I have found relief I thought I would never have.  
Since seeing Isobel I have managed to reduce my painkiller intake , stopped wearing the belt (only after perhaps heavy lifting or activity), use of the scooter has also reduced around the supermarket.  
Working together with sobel has been a great experience!!  
Thank you so much

author: crater65
title: Very happy with the way I was treated.
body: A few days ago I had an appointment for a vaginal ultrasound. I was extremely nervous but the sonographer and nurse really put me at ease and made the whole experience so much better for me. I was very happy with how I was treated.

title: Speedy Response to EConsult Request
body:
Having completed an EConsult form just after 8am yesterday morning, I got a call back in less than an hour.  I spoke to a friendly practise assistant who asked if I could come in for an appointment later that day.

My appointment was bang on time and the GP I saw was really nice.  Made me feel comfortable and relaxed and quickly diagnosed my health concern.  I was given some advice and a prescription.

I was very impressed with the speed of response and with everyone I dealt with.

title: New patient- great service
body: Recently joined the practice and I have been getting confused over my insulin as my previous practice changed it and didn’t explain anything to me. Hollybrook managed to get me straight in with a diabetes nurse. I brought up what medication I had to the appointment and she demonstrated what I need to do and how I need to change the cartridge. She took her time to make sure I understood my doses. Very pleasant, extremely helpful.

author: christine61
title: My experience following leg break
body:
I attended A & E at the end of July, having hurt my left leg. The x-ray showed I had a double fracture of my left lower leg.  
I was admitted to ward B23 where I remained for a week. I would just like to say a massive thanks to all the fantastic staff I encountered, from Veronica in minor injuries, fracture clinic staff, x-ray staff, all staff on ward B23 including nurses, health care assistants, domestic and catering staff, porters and ambulance staff during my stay.  
There are so many negative stories regarding the NHS but I personally have nothing but praise for Forth Valley Royal Hospital staff.  
THANK YOU ALL

author: Pig sick
title: Relieved when our father got home.
body:
Awful awful ward.  
Ward 2b appears to be full of inexperienced staff, only junior doctors on that ward. If you have anything other than a broken bone you’ve had it. All the nurses we spoke to didn't seem to have finished their training. We found the staff nurses a joke, they didn’t seem to know anything about their patients or their condition.  
We were extremely worried about our father who had broken his hip. After his op he developed delirium. They didn’t seem to have a clue about how to deal with it. Apparently they have a “delirium nurse” but getting to see them was impossible because there is only one and they have to do several hospitals.  
They just assumed he had dementia, which he didn’t, and even then they were just dismissive of it.  
Appalling staff in our view, so uncaring. We were relieved when our father got home.

author: Eigentone
title: Excellent service.
body:
A&E visit for excessive bleeding after tooth extraction. Excellent service. Predicted wait was 5-6 hours, but was triaged within 10 mins and fixed by doctor within 1 hour.  
Many thanks to those who contributed.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: A&E is broken
body: My husband was referred to A&E from 111 and what we experienced when there was a broken system. Basic observations at first with no triage for at least an hour.  A much needed CT scan was conducted quickly but we were there 11 hours overnight before the results were received. Unnecessary blood tests, no information on delays unless you disturb the nurses to ask. No care in the waiting room. The observation person was browsing cars to buy on the computer. The wait time was increasing but not relayed to patients. The waiting area was cramped and overcrowded with patients asking patients for info and help and staff constantly calling out for patients not there. I have never been more disappointed with an outdated broken system. The only saving grace was the polite apologetic nurse.  Even the doctor didn’t even mention the unnecessary blood tests!

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: Anon1978
title: Poor service and excellent service
body:
Just a little note to let you know that something needs to be done about the poor care we experiencedon C4. The cleanliness is also lacking somewhat, with leaking air con unit, bin pedal not working, dirty linen left on floors, yellow bins left full with soiled waste. Also, respiratory rates should not be documented as 16 if it's actually 30. We believe that catheters were left in to make it easier for the staff.  
Senior staff needs to show other staff a little more respect, rather than barking orders and speaking down to colleagues. Senior managers should also refrain from talking about patients on corridors in earshot of visitors, confidentiality is important, is it not?  
B3 ward was a breath of fresh air. Clean and tidy. Happy staff. And a calmness that is evident walking on the ward.  
Both wards are equally busy, but leagues apart.

title: A reassuring service
body: Attended the plastics department on the 10th of August 2023, of course, you feel apprehensive, however the staff were very reassuring and soon put me at ease. I left a lot happier than when I arrived. Thank you all.

author: defenderbt96
title: A complete and utter waste of time.
body:
I don't feel it is a safe place to be treated at all as there is a lack of interest in consequences of asking you to attend assessments where you are clearly being triggered and you leave traumatized for days.  
Do I feel I am in good hands - No. Do I feel that someone has my back and I can trust them to put me first- No.  
They lack the confidence to run the treatment or make a decision that I as a patient badly need from them and you are having to tell them the same things repeatedly, which I find inefficient and ineffective and lazy. Why are they asking you what do you want after telling staff repeatedly in assessments and waiting 7.5 months for something from them, and with a GP referral telling them. They can change goalposts because they can. I have seen 3 different people and I want to wear a sweatshirt that says Not Again.Do not expect to get treated, you won't get treated.With them, it's like a heart surgeon having to ask someone else what to do all the time - would you want that surgeon to operate on you? You come away not feeling reassured. I am not saying that they don't come across as nice people but I don't care. I want help and I want it asap. You will get assessments and delays to the point where you will completely lose the will to live and they will furnish you with a reason that will make you feel way worse than when you first approached and you will start to doubt yourself and why would anyone put themselves through such upheaval and distress just to access help. They cause you to deteriorate. It's not rocket science but mental health can wait and wait and wait at St Marys. This is how they operate - tough. Why is such a crucial service allowed to get away with this?The place is mainly backed up by answer phones and if you can find one person who know staff members or where the hell they are located, good luck. Nobody knows who anyone is. I have been transferred numerous times to the wrong departments (answer phones) and it is confused with St Mary's hospital at times too. It's little things but they need to get their "reception" act together and certain teams are totally confusing to their own staff! This is not a timely service. It wastes time on assessments and faffing about. What is the cost of this? Assessments I have found awful and so far in my case; they have not got me anywhere and I do not know what to do because I can't face another one.Assessments are hugely triggering but there is no support post assessment whatsoever. I have had no outcome - after 7.5 months I have no date or idea when my 4th!!! assessment will be. (They want another one). I expect to be told eventually that they can't treat me and they will have some reason. (Sorry if I'm cynical but I have had zilch progress - nothing is happening and I'm at my wit's end).They tell me they want to get it right but I'm sick of being asked to put my hand in the meat grinder again. I can't see any light at the end of the tunnel.I'm afraid to tell them what I think to their face because they have all the power over my treatment and they know this and I know this.It's all about the service and the least important person is the patient (despite what they say) and telling them anything about what triggers you is a waste of time, a complete and utter waste of time.I should have walked out of the last assessment.Would I recommend them - no. I'd like to see something concrete from them after putting me through this process. I can't go through another "assessment" because I feel demolished after the last one and I'm getting nowhere with how things are being set up supposedly to help me.

readBy.name: Leeds and York NHS Partnership NHS Foundation Trust

title: Appointments
body: My husband was given an appointment in July we attended put his information into the machine was told to go to a clinic and his number would be called…arrived at the clinic to find no doctor or nurse returned to reception to be told there was no clinic that evening even though we had confirmation on us…returned home rang the secretary the following morning to be told that it should have been a phone appointment not a face to face they couldn’t apologise enough which is fair enough we can all make mistakes…we then got a phone call the following day with an oncologist who did the review on the phone and was told he would be having another appointment in six weeks we are five weeks on no appointment have been ringing leaving messages because his cancer medication is about to run out no one has got back,this really isn’t good enough.If we don’t hear anything now we will have to go down the pals route as if we haven’t got enough stress.

title: Refused to take us on as patients
body: States we are within the area catchment however the guy I spoke to on the phone was rude and very ignorant and just kept huffing and ignoring everything I was stating which was factual and truth he didn’t care in the slightest. suggest you get knew staff that actually wants to do their job and not refuse patients

author: NHSse64
title: Appointment at Causeway
body: I had an appointment at Causeway hysteroscopy dept. I was taken on time with the whole procedure explained before and during my procedure. The staff were so professional and made me feel at ease during the whole procedure. Vicki and her assistants are a credit to the NHS.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: karenmo95
title: The care of all of the midwifery team was second to none.
body:
I was induced last week due to some potential problems with my babies growth. The induction process was smooth and by the next day I was in the labour ward. In the end the birth of my baby girl was quite quick and traumatic for me.  
The midwives that looked after me through my labour/delivery/theatre & post natal were absolutely incredible. I would not have been able to get through last Saturday without Katie and then the after birth care from Lauren was amazing. Nothing was a problem for either of them and they really supported me through a pretty rough day/night.  
So so glad in the end my baby girl was delivered safely and I can’t thank either of them enough for being such a positive support to me throughout. There was also a clinical support worker who was present for my birth and afterwards who I cannot remember the name of. I’m so sorry as she was also amazing. The care of all of the midwifery team was second to none.

title: Excellent treatment
body: I have undergone cataract surgery on both eyes with Spa Medica Stockton on Tees between 12th June and 2nd August 2023.The results have been life changing and the service provided by Spa Medica has been faultless. I would highly recommend them to anyone requiring this treatment

title: Considerate care
body: I was nervous about attending the practice for my cervical smear test but the nurse was so considerate and gentle the experience was much better than I expected. Thank you for the kind and professional care provided. It makes a big difference

author: Msmith224
title: Thorough, professional and friendly
body: My 3rd time here in a year. 2nd time triaged by Kit. Great service, quick but thorough, professional and friendly from reception to nursing staff to radiography. As a service user I felt very confident in the service and as a nurse I felt very proud.

title: Not fit for purpose
body:
I think the new klinik system is not fit for purpose. You are asked to fill a form which seems to ask too many things and then there is no response…you are made to wait in limbo while the clock runs out during the day. Then you must wait for 111. Shouldn’t you have some system to show where your request is in the queue so people have some idea that someone cares. At least in the old system, we knew straight away whether we would get an appointment or not. 

Please improve before its too late

title: Vine Medical Group @ Waterlooville Health Centre
body: An efficient system with very little wait time. Courteous staff and pleasant facilities with ample parking

title: How a practice should be
body: Efficient and professional. Arranging an appropriate appointment is easy if you approach it correctly. My recent appointments have been necessary but not urgent and I have been able to see the GP I  chose within the timescale I needed to.

title: No appointments available
body: We live in Bitterne Park and wish to be seen at Bitterne Park Surgery. We can get an appointment to see a nurse, although there can be several weeks to wait. I have just made one for 3 weeks time.  My husband needs to be seen by a GP, he is elderly and we have no transport. It takes an hour from here to get to Weston Lane involving two buses.  We have been told there are no GP appointments available at Bitterne Park in the next week, but one has been requested. If he gets worse in the meantime, call 111.  I would not recommend this practice under any circumstances.

author: Selle89
title: They were friendly and kind and genuinely care about their patients
body:
After calling NHS 24 due to a suspected breast abscess, I was referred to the out of hours GP service at the New Victoria hospital.  
The staff were great and I was examined promptly, the doctor confirmed a breast abscess and referred me straight to ward 66 at GRI. The man at reception arranged transport to take me there.  
I arrived at GRI and from the moment I got there the staff were excellent, they all made me feel comfortable and I was extremely well cared for.  
I was moved to ward 65 the following morning and again all the staff were amazing.  
I really would like to thank everyone involved in my care over the past couple of days. The nurses work so hard and nothing is a problem for them, they were always friendly and kind and genuinely care about their patients, they are rushed off their feet but they never stop. Amazing.  
Thank you so much ward 65 and 66.

title: Best practice
body:
I have been with practice for 30 years 
I have always been treated with a smile at reception always ready to help and the doctors are so good I would not ever leave I would recommend  the practice to anyone

author: KateR74
title: Every staff member was kind, respectful and helpful
body:
My father was admitted to Pilgrim's ED via ambulance with difficulty in breathing having initially called 111 for advice.  
Despite being insanely busy he was assessed, had various investigations completed, was reviewed and discharged within 5 hours. Every staff member he encountered was kind, respectful, helpful and apologetic for delays (not their fault.... everyone was working flat out). To maintain such professionalism and compassion - as well as maintain a sense of humour - in what seemed like a complete maelstrom of activity is amazing (I would probably cry in a corner if faced with what the team that day were). Thank you so much to all that were involved in ensuring he was OK.... He's home now and under strict instructions to behave sensibly!!

title: Not as great as it used to be
body:
Telephoned the surgery after recieving a text to call them. I was number 2 in line and still it took 46 minutes to get through to someone.

The prior week I went into the surgery to book a same day appointment not aware that they no longer offer bookings onsite. The receptionist kindly booked an appointment for 11:10am as I was there already she said. I asked if I could wait and remained on site and was told yes. At 11:22am I approached the same reception to query the appointment as the time had passed and I wasn't called. She looked on the system and said she didn't understand what happened but would check. Other people were in line so she asked me to have a seat. She then attended to two people and although I made a point to sit in her line of vision, she seemed to have forgotten me eventhough she also passed by me twice. Another 30 minutes, I rejoined the reception line and was approached by another member of staff who had noticed I had been in the surgery for over 2 hours. This person seemed concerned and proceeded to help by asking another receptionist to check. Apparently, I was noted as not attended even though I never left the surgery, this was due to that I was never checked in by the first receptionist and same one who said she didn't know what happened and would check. This more helpful member of staff apologised and proceeded to check with the doctor to let him know and ask if I could be seen. The doctor saw me and I'm grateful. I was however upset that the first receptionist could not own her error and be honest and take the same actions as the member of staff who helped instead of being dishonest and then ignoring me. 

I've been with this surgery for nearly 20 years now but in recent times its become more challenging and confusing to deal with. Despite this it still has some familiar faces and GPs who offer great service.

title: Outstanding friendly and efficient service
body:
I contracted a painful ear infection and was unable to get an appointment with own GP. 
Although the waiting room was busy I was seen in 40 minutes and was prescribed antibiotics. Within two days I was feeling so much better.

The ear infection was making me lose  my balance and the receptionist was really sweet and offered to help after seeing how wobbly I was ! 

I feel very lucky to have received such great treatment so swiftly

title: Colposcopy Amazing care
body: The care my daughter received yesterday In Colposcopy couldn’t have been any better if she had been a relative of the staff. Words can’t describe how amazing that team is at the QE! She was very anxious on arrival however the nurses but her at ease from the minute she arrived until they seen her out. Even insisted on sweet treats and a cup of tea before she left double checking she was ok to leave. Absolute angels they are. Only wish I was allowed to give you their names, what a lovely bunch of ladies, many thanks xxx

title: Great gp
body: The gp was thorough and gave me complete confidence. Booked the follow up appointment for 4 days later to be sure all was ok

title: Avoid this practice, the phone system will make…
body:
i have been using this practice for many years, but only stay for continuity because I like my GP. i have been on hold for an hour, and came in at 2nd place in the queue, it is still ringing and i am now first in the queue.

the phone system is really disfunctional and should be scrapped. how can i still be waiting an hour when it says i am first in the queue. terrible service, really rude reception staff when you do get through. i have given up after an hour. appalling.

title: Unbelievably excellent care
body: This group of people are an absolute asset to the hospital, from the minute we walked in to the minute we left. there were complications which were explained well to both me and my partner, which eased both our minds, the kindness and care we both experienced was amazing, words can’t describe what I owe and how I feel about the delivery suite and maternity ward, they went above and beyond to look after my partner, when she experienced a bad bleed I have never seen so many people rush to the aid of another, it was truly inspiring, thank you to all of you, I hope you all have wonderful lives and get everything you want from it, your all wonderful, kind and amazing people, thank you will never be enough, but it will have to do, thank you so much

readBy.name: James Paget University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic staff and a great experience
body: I unfortunately had an accident and sustained a fractured wrist. I was seen by the urgent care team who were extremely helpful and efficient and I was then referred to orthopaedics for a review. I had 2 appointments 4 weeks apart. Both clinics were running pretty much on time and everyone I encountered treated me with respect, ensured I had all the information I needed and answers any questions I had. The clinics were extremely busy yet seemed to be running very efficiently. I cannot thank all the nurses, radiographers and doctors that I saw enough

title: No chance of seeing a “GP”
body: If you don’t have access to internet or are too old to be able to use the internet. As my father is 94, he falls into this category, you have no chance of actually seeing a GP. Receptionist seldom answer phone calls. If you are lucky enough to get through, you get told “ the surgery is closed, ring 111”.

title: Care at its best
body:
It was clear throughout my stay that I was in the care of a welcoming, friendly and professional team who made it seem that their sole purpose was to inspire my recovery from my accident in the shortest time - yet every other patient must have been similarly motivated such was the team's enthusiasm. When I was suffering a loss of confidence I was continually re-assured and even the criticism was good-hearted.
The only downside was the pressure exerted on me to vacate the bed. Strangely this first arose when I was suffering a period of hypotension, had little confidence regarding my mobility and was certainly not suitable for safe discharge. My wife and I had a proposition for my discharge but it seemed that only the hospital's plan was acceptable so the pressure continued. Fortunately, however, thanks to a perceptive, skilful and flexible tradesman, we were able to make changes at home and  test them to ensure that all safety issues were covered. I was therefore able to be discharged, probably some 48hrs earlier than following hospital strategy. I was able to save a not insubstantial sum of money and the stress and hassle of purchasing new furniture along with the removal/storage of existing furniture. More importantly, I returned home to continue my recuperation in near-normal circumstances - a huge psychological bonus.
Overall, I felt that I was in best place and could not have received better care.
Thank you Team NGH, you were superb!

title: Appointment cancelled
body: I've got appointment in one month in advance and received message that my appointment been cancelled without my permission,also I've been calling to reception and they have been rood to me,thinking to change GP

title: Excellent service and team
body:
I was incredibly pleased with the care I received at Withington Hospital. 

After sustaining an injury at work, the plastics team were able to see me the next morning and I had my surgery the same afternoon. My surgeon was very professional and out me at ease. He performed the procedure with care and skill. 

The after care was excellent; I was seen once a week for the following three weeks to make sure I was getting on okay. My appointments were always bang on schedule.

The medical team were extremely friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Everyone involved in my care here was absolute pleasure to deal with.

title: Great support and help
body:
Rang and spoke to a very helpful caring as considerate lady about my mum 
She was really helpful and fulfilled her promise ringing back with all the information answers I needed 
She went above and beyond she is a credit to the surgery

title: Amazing service
body: I had my ADHD test with psychiatry-uk and was very satisfied with their service. Good communication throughout. It was easy to use the portal as well. The Dr who did my test was also very caring and empathetic.

title: Un-helpful
body:
Not sure how they can be accepting new patients. It is impossible to book an appointment unless it is an urgency. I tried to follow up on tests and could not get anything on line. I called and the earliest they could offer was September. I mentioned I have surgery this week and will not be mobile. It made no difference. 
The last few doctors I spoke to treated me as if I am below them , not trying to understand my perspective at all. I use private insurance but unfortunately still need a gp referral, and given how difficult it is to get a appointment makes issues pile up. I am looking to change practice

title: Great Practice
body:
Came in for bloods, was seen on time and nurse explained the process she was undertaking fully and how to get my results. 
Reception staff very helpful and polite. 
Very positive experience

title: Getting an appointment
body: Had problems with my hearing which was bothering me. I was told to come along to the surgery at 7.50a.m Monday morning and join the queue which I did. When I reached the reception desk I was told a Doctor would call me later that day which they did and saw a Doctor at 2.45pm. Very impressed all round thank you. Only fair to write this positive review,as often we can end up writing negative reviews when our experience is not what we wanted.

title: Superb and caring treatment by all concerned
body: My visits today were a pleasure despite needing treatment and advice. The reception area staff made me feel welcome and at ease. The doctors I saw were so caring and made me feel a valued 'customer'. They didn't rush and I couldn't be more pleased with the consultation and follow up. Many thanks. The total opposite fall then negative press at the moment. A dedicated team.

title: Issues with repeat prescription
body: I’ve had to order my repeat prescription in 2 orders and the 1st order isn’t being sorted as I need to re order my asthma medicines.

title: Amazing!!
body: Myself and my daughter visited today , and I cannot thank them enough, very professional and put me at ease and my daughter was made to feel very comfortable  right away and was very calm and it was all down to the lovely staff.

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Time and attention
body: I have not seen a GP in person for a considerable time. Personnel have completely changed. I was seen on time and did not feel hurried. The GP listened and clearly ran through options. I felt I was being holistically assessed rather than a focus on one aspect. My concerns at the end of the appointment are: I am left to chase up a hospital consultant; medication was the first suggestion for 2 issues even though I am already on a number of tablets; the family history on my notes was significantly incorrect leading to inappropriate risk factors. I was pleasantly surprised to be able to book another appointment at reception rather than the online or telephone palava.

title: Efficient very quick service
body:
I rang for a GP appointment was given available dates and then informed there was also one in 5 minutes ,which I was fortunately able to attend  
Saw Gp on time and  also then another Gp colleague  who had a specialist interest and knowledge of  my problem .
I was given  advice and prescription and out of surgery within 20 mins of ringing for an appointment .
I felt I had to share this experience when there is so much negativity around obtaining a GP appointment .I could not have had a more positive one .
Thank you to all admin and medical staff

title: Extremely helpful
body: After having issues with 111, contacted the Surgery, i could not have been more pleased/ happy with how the Doctor and Receptionist dealt with the problem. Thank you for the kindness,understanding and help that was given.

title: 15 hours before callback!
body: Rang at 2.30pm Friday because gp had no appointments and son had tonsils so swollen he couldn't swallow. Gave up after waiting 20 minutes and used the online version. It said we would be called back within 2 hours. 15 hours later, whilst I was asleep, I had 2 missed calls from them. 15 hours!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Superb Practice
body:
Having not had hardly any need to visit my GP until February 2020, I visited them because of a growth on the back of my left leg which turned out to be a malignant melanoma.

From that time until now I cannot speak highly enough of the practice. From the reception staff through to the GP’s everybody that I have come into contact with have all acted with the greatest friendliness and professionalism.

Whenever I have completed online consultations I have been contacted within 24-48 hours and feel as if I’ve been given priority treatment, such is the high level of care.

I am very lucky to belong to a practice that treats me as a human being & takes time to listen to my issues when needed.

Thank you all for being the way that you are

title: Great staff
body:
Excellent reception, Very quick admission. Very light reception area. Parking very easy,
Cloakroomsclean and tidy.
refreshments are available.
Seating area comfortable.

title: Excellent care from sexual health nurse
body: The sexual health nurse I spoke to was excellent. Very sympathetic and understanding. She took the time to talk me through options and understood my specific circumstances.

title: Great Drs.
body:
I lived in Exmouth from 2017-2022.
Had 4 different practices through moving around and Imperial was by far the best. I just wish my daughter could register there, she has tried.

title: Professional & Prompt Service
body:
All members of the team were both professional & helpful. 
All appointments we're prompt & emails & letters sent confirming appointments and numbers given to cancel. 
Following appointments we're dealt with in the same Manor,which was very reassuring...I felt really looked after....Thank you !

title: Left abandoned an hour on the phone
body:
Im suffering from an infection 2 week already and received disgusting behavior today. First the doctor said shell call back because there was bad reception when she didnt. Second there was 5 people waiting for 1 hour !! I was clearly abandoned by number one for about hal an hour. This doesnt make sense so someone who couldnt care less couldnt be bothered answering the phone. This triggers anxiety and stress for someone who is already not at her best. Then finally when his majesty picked up the phone he told me dr will call me back . Of course she didnt. 
Lastly my sample posted on tuesday probably never arrived as I still didnt receive results. Its an infection not a biopsy ! Whats the point of treating patients 2 months later when they had time to suffer a great deal . Pathetic.

title: Freezing air conditioning
body: I have been suffering from pneumonia since 4th July when I had to wait for the best part of an hour in the icy waiting room at Kenmore. The air conditioning was set ridiculously and as I was dressed for a hot day I had no extra clothes to put on.

title: Terrible service
body:
I had my phone in my hand to take a phone consultation. The phone rang on a silenced call I called them back and they said they couldn’t help and I would have to go back to my GP I asked if the person was in the building the receptionist said yes I asked could they call me back she said I have to go back to my GP so to summarise I didn’t miss the call they called me on silent I called straight back to be told by a rude and unhelpful receptionist to go back to the GP
This leaves me continuing with a great deal of pain and not able to walk properly back to well I don’t know where

title: Again, so helpful
body: Medwyn surgery have again been so helpful in sorting out a speedy prescription. I have used them for several years and have always found them responsive when I have needed an appointment or have a specific prescription request. They respond to quickly to messages, and I am grateful for the service.  Thank you.

title: Gold standard for maternity care
body: The maternity team who looked after me, including the infant feeding team that helped when I was struggling to breastfeed are amazing people. I am so greatful for the help they provided, the consitstance and generally warmth. They truly are exceptional people from: working in partnership with other agencies, to reassuring me and any anxieties I had by helping me work through them. They also supported me by making sure I got rest and didn't physically push too hard that would have set my recovery back. This enabled me to leave the hospital with my baby after a week. While there they also suprised me with a birthday cake and the staff wished me happy birthday which really was thoughtful and appreciated making the day special.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

author: sukaz
title: The team could not have been more professional.
body:
I was referred by my GP for an ultrasound and the department contacted me two days later with an appointment for the following day. Each member of staff at reception, the cheerful clinical support worker and the lovely person who preformed the scan seemed genuinely caring and compassionate people.  
Despite me inadvertently having not drunk enough water for the whole scan to be completed they were very kind, reassuring and understanding. They waited patiently for another 25 minutes for me to drink more and then conducted the procedure. The team could not have been more professional.

author: Alaska1
title: Thank you for your effort, class and professionalism.
body:
My Mum was rushed into A&E by Ambulance to the RHA at the end of July. She had passed out and banged her head badly as she went down.  
I would like to thank everyone involved in her care. From Ross and Danny that brought her in in their ambulance, to Dr Boom who received her, to Bobby and the other nurses in the unit. I can't remember the names of every team member involved but I can say that everyone was top drawer and the attention to her care is appreciated massively.  
She was admitted and stayed for a week in the CCU units. Thanks to every person that played a part in her care.  
Within 4 hours of arrival, she had an ECG, whole body X-ray and CT Scan. All performed with the minimum of fuss and all without any significant delay.  
On behalf of my Mum, Rona, myself and all the family, thank you for your effort and your class and your professionalism.

author: K08277
title: Amazing team in labour ward
body:
Thank you for the swift action of the team in June to help deliver our little girl. Special mention to David who assisted with the birth competently and swiftly so she could receive the care she needed as soon as possible. He clearly communicated what was happening at all times making us feel calm and included.  
Despite the severity of the situation the team made me feel at ease throughout the birth, making it an overall positive experience. Kyra made us feel extremely comfortable with her kind and compassionate nature and she went above and beyond coming to check up on us in neonatal for a few days following!  
Student midwife Cara also stood out with her communication and professionalism. Sorry to the rest of the team as can’t remember all names but we felt very well cared for by everyone involved in our care! Thank you so much!

author: Buccleuch
title: Excision of basal cell carcinoma
body:
Following referral from the dermatology dept, I was admitted for day surgery at Forth Valley Hospital.  
David & Laura, the two nurses, made the process wholly bearable & David maintained a running conversation with me throughout the process.  
I really appreciated it!

author: DB07
title: What a real difference you all made 😊😊😊.
body:
This is a story of thanks for care and kindness. When I went into hospital for general surgery the staff were amazing - at all stages they explained what was about to happen and were very kind and caring throughout.  
I will no doubt have forgotten some names (sorry), but Paula and Amy did an excellent job of looking after me before and after the procedure. Donna, Sarah, Marc and all those in theatre did everything to keep me reassured before and then to visit and check in after. Thank you everyone - what a real difference you all made 😊😊😊.

author: COPD warrior
title: CAU staff are Angels 😇
body:
I was admitted to CAU for a few hours on a Saturday after my COPD had a bad flare up and I was finding it difficult to breathe. All the staff were absolutely fabulous from domestic staff to Susan the boss, every one of them was great.  
Carly and Susan were absolutely on the ball. Everything was dealt with so quickly, they are great with all the patients and nothing was any trouble for them.  
The 2 of them deserve medals and are a credit to the NHS.

author: caringbe84
title: I did not feel rushed and they answered all my queries
body:
I had to visit A and E one evening. I cannot praise the staff enough for their care and politeness when they are having such a difficult time. I had a follow up the next day with Dr Wanklyn and again was impressed by the nurses and him with their care.  
I did not feel rushed and they answered all my queries.  
Please forward my thanks to them

title: Dissatisfied
body: Today I tried to contact the practice regarding my husband who had been unwell for 4 days the attempt I was informed the queue was full I then rang again to try and arrange a home visit I haven’t done this for 30 years so it’s not something we do often. This call rang and rang then cut off. I then tried the appointment again after all the guff at the beginning I was cut off again did not have any option at all. I then took my husband to A&E where he was looked after and put on a drip. To say I am disappointed is an understatement this surgery used to be really good now I wouldn’t recommend it to anyone it’s time things changed my daughter is a nurse at a doctors practice they speak to everyone and are now offering face to face for all appointments.I would have been happy to speak to someone but unfortunately that is to much to expect now.

author: Gynea veteran
title: Unhappy about previous discharge
body:
After a complex history of problems (around 10 years and 5 procedures) I reported pain and bleeding on my 1 year check up and was sent for a scan. I was told a new growth was present and discharged as it was nothing to worry about. This was in January.  
The pain and abdo swelling got worse and finally my GP agreed to a further scan now showing 3 new growths increasing in size and a ovarian cyst. The result is that I'm back on a waiting list since April to be seen, and living with around 17 hours of pain each day, when in reality and my past history I don't feel I should have been discharged.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
